intro: Laccosperma secundiflorum, commonly known as the narrow-flowered laccosperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
